question: Which of the following Pala ruler was called Uttarapathasvamin or Lord of Northern India?
explanation: Dharmapala's sovereignty was accepted by the rulers of both west and south India including those of Punjab, western hill states, Rajputana, Malwa and Berar. He became the paramount lord in Northern India. That's why he is also called Uttarapathasvamin or Lord of Northern India.
